description: Coefficients in expansion of theta_3(q) * theta_3(q^7) in powers of q.
comments: Number of integer solutions to the equation x^2 + 7*y^2 = n.
references: G. E. Andrews, R. Lewis and Z.-G. Liu, An identity relating a theta series to a sum of Lambert series, Bull. London Math. Soc., 33 (2001), 25-31.
J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p 102 eq 9.
formula: Coefficients in expansion of Sum_{ i, j = -inf .. inf } q^(i^2 + 7*j^2).Euler transform of period 28 sequence [ 2, -3, 2, -1, 2, -3, 4, -1, 2, -3, 2, -1, 2, -6, 2, -1, 2, -3, 2, -1, 4, -3, 2, -1, 2, -3, 2, -2, ...].Expansion of (eta(q^2) * eta(q^14))^5 / (eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^7) * eta(q^28))^2 in powers of q.G.f.: Product_{k>0} (1 - x^(2*k)) * (1 + x^(2*k-1))^2 * (1 - x^(14*k)) * (1 + x^(14*k-7))^2.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x] EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x^7], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Feb 22 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^-2 * eta(x^2 + A)^5 * eta(x^4 + A)^-2 * eta(x^7 + A)^-2 * eta(x^14 + A)^5 * eta(x^28 + A)^-2, n))};
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
